alert.note: Alert for Central Tangipahoa; Eastern Orleans; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern St. Tammany; Southeast St. Tammany; Southwestern St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 3:17AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Orleans, St. Tammany, central Tangipahoa Parishes in southeastern Louisiana and southwestern Hancock Counties through 345 AM CDT... At 317 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles north of Robert to 6 miles northwest of Lake Catherine. Movement was southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Slidell, Hammond, Covington, Pearl River, Abita Springs, Independence, Madisonville, Folsom, Lake Catherine, Pearlington, Lacombe, Robert, Tickfaw and Slidell Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 261 and 273. Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 7. Interstate 12 between mile markers 48 and 84. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 38 and 40. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Tangipahoa; Eastern Orleans; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern St. Tammany; Southeast St. Tammany; Southwestern St. Tammany
